citeinfo.origin: H.H. Veldhuijzen van Zanten and I.J.H. Isbrücker (eds) A cooperation between ETI, the Zoological Museum Amsterdam and the Artis Library, University of Amsterdam.
citeinfo.title: Bloch's Fishes

descript.abstract: The importance of Marcus Elieser Bloch’s "Allgemeine Natur-geschichte der Fische", even for modern ichthyology, can be easily demonstrated but hardly exaggerated. As Bloch’s opus is of prime importance to fish taxonomy and a must for every scientist working in this field of zoology, the present revision will enlighten fish taxonomists the world over. Bloch’s work contains extensive descriptions and illustrations of some 500 species, including 267 presented as new to science or needing new names, many of which are still valid and in general use. Moreover, he introduced 19 new generic names, many of which were accepted. Dr I. J. H. Isbrücker compared the hand-coloured plates and accompanying text with modern nomenclature and thereby resolved numerous errors and inaccuracies. His work has greatly improved the usefulness of this rare volume. Every plate is now available in digital form, with both the original and recent scientific name of the species illustrated.
descript.purpose: Bloch's Fishes will serve as prime reference to fish taxonomists.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

dataqual.complete: Bloch’s work contains extensive descriptions and illustrations of some 500 species, including 267 presented as new to science.

overview.eaover: Entity - fish; Attributes - fish taxonomy, descriptions, illustrations

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 3.1x/ 95/98, 486 CPU, 8MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 2x speed CD-ROM or higher. Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 680x0/PowerPC CPU, 8MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 2x speed CD-ROM or higher.
